captions.text:
- Oh babe, Dear John is
on, I wanna see that.
- So how was your day today?
My gosh you look so nice.
- Think I'm just gonna go like this.
You know, jeans, keep it casual.
- Oh my god, I can't get this to turn on.
and I took it straight to the bucket.
- And I just feel like it sucks
'cause Alison won't be there for me
and I've been there for her.
- Justin, Alison has the long brown hair.
You just have so many friends.
Oh honey I can fix it.

- No, babe what kind of
food does this place serve?
- Dude you gotta hang onto the ball!
- Oh, what are you guys talking about?

- No, Justin, you were supposed
to make the reservation.

- You know what, whatever
Justin, whatever, OK?
- Is it that time of the month?
- It's that time of the month.
- Hey babe, I wanna talk to you

I just feel like--
- Oh wait, look,
Did you say you want to see this?

It's two more hours, we should
just watch the rest of this.

- I'm so excited it'll just
be the two of us tonight.
I've been telling you about her.

- Hi, nice to meet you.
- Hi, nice to meet you.
- Yeah I've heard a lot about you too.
Justin's my wusband: my work husband.
- J and J 'cause like Jeannine and...
I spit cheese, I'm the true MC,
- I think I could be a rapper.

comments.text:
So, I went to my ex boyfriend's parent's New Years party this year, and he 
told me that it would be just the two of us with his family- which I was 
totally cool with, I loved his family. When he picked me up at the place we 
were meeting up at, he opened the door to the backseat of his car and his 
friend was there... Nope, it doesn't stop there. When we got to his house, 
I was greeting the family and stuff and seeing what was new, and ANOTHER 
one of his friends was there. He had me come outside with his friends in 
the backyard in the cold and play Pictionary with all of them... Eventually 
I had enough of this, and went outside. He came in and checked on me like 
15 minutes later and was like "Oh, hey, are you feeling comfortable here?" 
and I was REALLY pissed off (I told him before that his friends make me 
feel uncomfortable, I have really bad social anxiety when it comes to 
people I don't know) so I just said "No." All day he asked me to hang out 
with him and his friends, and I kept rejecting him because I seriously 
wasn't feeling it. I ended up spending New Years with his mom, eating 
cupcakes and her showing me his baby pictures and stuff. Great start to 
2015.﻿

comments.text:
+xxBroadwayGalxx Please excuse the length.

Nah because your defending females and taking offence to the word feminazi,

Ok hold on, reverse, WTF does LGBTQIA stand for!? seriously, LOL, WTF, ROFL 
all make sense because they're expressions used regularly. But this is the 
first time l have encountered an acronym with a Q in it.

The Q. isn't who stopped them, its why they were stopped? lts not logical 
to expend all your 'assets' when men go to fight they then come home to 
heal their bruises, makes more sense then everyone leaving for the place to

so there is no point. You really try to be on one side but the way l'm 
reading what your writing, it seems you're on the other. So now your saying

negative about muslim state apparel, but from that last comment it would 
seem you're praising it.

l think clothes are good, they can compliment the wearer, but naked we come 
and naked we go.

So l guess the wars, the females voted in to head of state, female 
monarchs, Macbeth and that saying 'behind every strong man is a strong 
woman', etc is all made up? How l personally know that the beats aren't 
true! l was beaten as youngster (l really was bad, but we'll leave that) 
but l always beaten my mum, never by dad. My dad was too strong, in fact 
look it up on youtube/google, l'm sure mainly sons get beaten by their mum. 
Well of course l take sides, what do you think l sat down in the library or 
didn't give up my seat on the tube?

Although its slightly wasted here, people treat people like people, not 
like genders, l think l'll save it for the usa, l would have a ball, :-D.

You see gender and race are siblings, you can't be from the side that feels 
oppression give it back but then say your not an oppressor. To truly be

comments.text:
+Thomas Owusu-Abayie I am on the side of equality.

l used to hold no prejudice against anything, l thought fuck it you do you,

taking the piss and raping are two very different stories. Even rapists

comments.text:
+Thomas Owusu-Abayie I have said several times that I am not a feminist. 
Seriously, can you even read? And no. True feminists are not sexist.

Actually, no. There is a very large spectrum and many inbetweens. 


There are people who are neither racist nor sexist. To anyone. At all. 


Again, feminazi is a derogatory term and is very offensive. Using that term 
once again proves how sexist you are. Women don't, as you say, 'have the 
world' and, as I have said already, don't always want more. And you know

coming from rapists, talking about their victims' clothing? And I am 
well-aware of the fact that there are impoverished countries but no matter 
the state of other countries, no one deserves to be ridiculed (id est, 
bullied) for any reason.


Sexism was very prominent back then. Men could beat their wives and 
daughters and not a damn thing was done about it. And hell no, women were 
not waited on. Back then, like now, most of the population were not 
wealthy. Also, women were considered possessions and not actual human 
beings. They didn't have the same rights, they weren't allowed to vote or 
voice their political opinions, they weren't allowed the same jobs as men, 
and they were beaten on top of all that. Women were expected to wait on 
men. You've undoubtedly heard of, "women should be seen and not heard," 
which is proof of how little men thought of women.

Again, don't assume that everyone who believes in equality or has realised 
that many women are oppressed are feminists, it just makes you a bigot, 
considering your views on the matter. Oppression has different degrees, but 
even women in developed countries can be oppressed. Consider women who are 
demeaned for wearing something that compliments their bodies and then are 
either ridiculed for their choice of outfit or are leered at.


That's not even true. Yes, fifty years ago and still, to this day, there is 
racism; but sexism was also much more prominent back then.


By 'treated the same,' you must mean poorly and with no consideration. 


It doesn't matter that they were female, it matters that they had been 
waiting and you were being inconsiderate.
comments.author: xxBroadwayGalxx

comments.text:
+xxBroadwayGalxx You would say that, but you haven't denied it, soooo l'm 
right. Don't worry, feminism will come and will it go, soon as people like 
you realise that this is petty bickering that won't count for anything.

Funny enough, now right now some girls said they were waiting for seat to 
free up in the library (this seat is nothing less then a bosses seat and is 
worth the wait) l came and as soon as l got  here one of the seats became 
free. Now do l look like a chump to let that seat go? No especially as 
there are no signs or notices saying "Out of respect, allow those that have 
been waiting to sit" or something like that.

Anyway to cut a long story short, she got all huffed and puffed, and she 
even had other feminists have her back, but l don't care l was seated. 
Reason how l knew they were feminist, is one of the said "This is funny, 
l'm writing about the oppression inflicted on women". Oppression!? Hardly! 
Living Zimbabwe, Cambodia, lraq, etc thats oppression.

The worst thing is 50 yrs ago it would have been racial.

With me l don't care, skin tone, gender, age, religion, race, etc. Everyone 
is human so everyone gets treated the same by me.

As if to say l pre-mediated the fact the seat l was going to take was a 
females seat! so increase the oppression l took it out of spite, To hear 
such non sense. l didn't even say anything, l left them to say what they 
wanted after all l and the seat.
comments.author: Thomas Owusu-Abayie

comments.text: +Thomas Owusu-Abayie That makes no sense whatsoever.
comments.author: xxBroadwayGalxx

comments.text:
+Mark Horrem The Feminist movement was necessary and, without it, women 
would not have the rights we do now. If not for the Suffragettes, we 
wouldn't be able to vote and we wouldn't be able to be represented in in 
courts. I refuse to identify as a feminist, not because of any antipathy 
towards feminism or feminists, but simply because I don't believe that 
equality is two-sided. That is why I believe in Egalitarianism, the 
philosophical thought-process that all human beings are equal and should be 
considered and treated as such. Of course, feminism is still a necessity, 
especially in places like Iran, Afghanistan, and Pakistan, to name a few. 
There does need to be advocacy for specific groups that experience 
inequality; there is need for such things as International Women's Day, 
just as there is still need for a Black History month, for a Gay Pride 
Parade. What do these groups each have in common? None are yet considered 
to be fully equal; there still exists sexism, racism, and homophobia. 

So, no. I am not a feminist. I am an egalitarian and I strongly believe 
that all human beings should be equal.
comments.author: xxBroadwayGalxx

comments.text:

comments.text:
+xxBroadwayGalxx Oh please spare me the details it seems like you don't

1st though in my defence, me using that term feminazi is supposed to be

before the suffragettes which were born in 1865, millenniums had gone by 
without an in house quarrel, but now thanks to all of these feminists, l

2. You know what this is long winded and pointless! For the simple fact

seriously l can't be arsed, l have too much work to be doing to be

Maybe when the work l have gets lighter we can continue this conversation, 
but l really doubt some super feminist is going to come and do it for me.
comments.author: Thomas Owusu-Abayie

comments.text:
+Thomas Owusu-Abayie I've said this once already and I'll reiterate, I am 
not a feminist. Secondly, the term feminazi is offensive to feminism on the 
whole. By using that term alone, one could identify you as sexist.

I don't care for fighting unless it's absolutely necessary.


Men have their own freewill and, not that all men do, but those who, as you 
say, 'give up' certain things for women are probably only doing that 
because, a) it's something that they probably shouldn't be doing and their 
relationship is on the line, which women give up certain things for as 
well, or b) they're only doing things like holding the door open (which, by 
the way, I do for everyone, regardless of gender) or helping with something 
heavy because they believe the woman incapable, which is usually a false 
assumption. Don't even get me started on how much women do for men, though 
I must also make the point here that these things can also be done for the 
women themselves, such as wearing make up or shaving. 


Again, this is the twenty-first century. Wives and mothers do work. There 
are a whole hell of a lot more working women and mothers than there are 
stay-at-home moms. Not only that, but women are in the military too and 
they do fight in wars. The only reason they didn't initially is because 
they weren't allowed. They have been for awhile now. Your entire point here 
is ridiculous and inaccurate.


None of those things are feminine and the fact that you think so brands you 
even further as a sexist. 


Hating women (misogyny) and being sexist are completely different things. 


I'll tell you something right now; I used to be in Air Cadets and the 
majority of our seventy-person squadron were male. Out of everyone, I, a 
female, received top marksman. So don't try to tell me that men have a 
better aim (no pun intended.)


They don't advertise it because then, /obviously/ they aren't going to get 
a lot of applicants. The fact is, though, the difference in pay is there.


I didn't say anything about morals. It is against the rules to ask about a 
woman's family and it is, to which degree I do not know, unlawful. It is 
against the law to fire a woman for being pregnant. She CAN be fired whilst 
on maternity leave, but not for BEING on maternity leave. Women get paid 
less while on maternity leave.


No, women do NOT still want more. Women, the majority of the time, just 
want to be treated as equal.
comments.author: xxBroadwayGalxx

comments.text:
+xxBroadwayGalxx l thought you were being a bitch, a feminazi, but from 
reading your last post l have reconsidered and thought you were actually up 
for a clean debate a conversation if you will, so l'm man enough to give 
you one.

A choke slam (not that you asked) is when one person grabs another around 
the neck with one hand, lifts the person off of their feet and slams them 
down on the ground, back or head first. Look it up and you'll see, that you 
can google, or you may want to try it out.

Nah, from now on equality reigns supreme, l'm not showing mercy to anyone 
for anything, the tube was the tester, l used to be a right gentleman, 
letting ladies on first, holding the door open, helping with heavy bags, 
etc. Now its every man for himself. Thats just how l feel, maybe if women 
realised just how much men gave up for you, you wouldn't keep playing the 
sexist card.

On the lighter side a man would wake up at 5 in the morning, get home for 8 
in evening so you can stay at home , not be a prisoner in your home, but so 
you don't have to go to work. The more serious side, a man would go to war 
and risk his very life so that his wife/ woman and kids have freedom.

You see undeniable facts, tell me 5 world records in sports that women hold 
that a males isn't better, you do that and l will tell you all the things 
that men are better then women at. Even feminine things men can be better 
at, such as cooking, cleaning, cloth making and hair dressing.

l'm really not sexist against women, in fact l hate men more then women but 
we'll save that. Skill is a very broad subject, but is usually aimed 
towards physical skill. Archery for instance, a man is the best at, snooker 
a man; basketball, surgery, jewellery making, etc.

l know around the world men are usually paid more then women for the same 
job, but here in the UK, most jobs advertise how much you earn, they don't 
say if your a man you can earn this much and a woman this much, that is 
wrong.

Morally allowed and lawfully allowed are two different things, you may not 
be morally allowed to ask personal questions but some including me still 
do. Lawfully allowed though is definite if your break the law there are 
repercussions. And its against the law to fire a woman specifically, when 
she is pregnant or on maternity leave. lts called paternity leave for 
males, its a lot shorter, they get paid less, its optional and they can 
still get fired whilst they are on it or about take it. 

And women still want more!
comments.author: Thomas Owusu-Abayie

comments.text:
+Thomas Owusu-Abayie There are things that women can do that men can't as 
well, and I'm pretty sure that women can 'choke slam' (whatever that is) 
their opponent.

It isn't because she's a woman that you should have been less of a douche 
and offered your seat, it's because she is older and she likely has aches 
and pains that come with being older. When you're older, someone will 
likely show you that courtesy, not that you deserve it.


Just because you work a twelve-hour shift doesn't make you deserving.


That is just not true. Guaranteed there are women that are better than men 
in sports. One sport in particular? Dance (and, yes, it is considered a 
sport) more specifically, ballet. Men can't be pointe dancers due to how 
their feet are formed. Women can. Not only that, but dancing on pointe is 
insanely difficult. There are a lot of men that I know whom I could 
probably best in a fight due to my being stronger and faster. And men are 
not /usually/ more skillful. And you say you aren't sexist.


It's a fact that men are paid more than women. Never mind experiencing it 
(which most women do) ; it is a fact.


You are not allowed to ask if they have kids. You simply are not allowed, 
never mind the reason. You. Are. Not. Allowed. Your interviewee has every 
right to decline an answer because it is not something that you can ask and 
it should not be something that determines whether or not she gets the job. 
And children are just as dependent on their father as their mother. What 
about all those single fathers? Men can go on maternity leave as well, by 
the way. They get paid for it as well. Neither gets paid full salary while 
on maternity leave. Women can get fired while pregnant, but not for /being/ 
pregnant. And you can be fired while on maternity leave.
comments.author: xxBroadwayGalxx
